body:
## Expected Behavior
We have a Temporal cronjob which runs at 06:00am on sunday.
We expect that the cronjob reschedules even after failing.

## Actual Behavior
A Temporal cronjob runs and reschedules the next run after completing the actual run successfully.
But if the cronjob fails, it does not reschedule the next run. That means that the cronjob does not exist anymore at this point.

## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

  1. Create Temporal cronjob (Which always fails)
  2. Check if the next Temporal cronjob run is scheduled

## Specifications

  - Version: 1.27.2
  - Platform: Java

comments.body:
Can you provide more information please?

1. Are you using the [schedules feature](https://javadoc.io/doc/io.temporal/temporal-sdk/latest/io/temporal/client/schedules/package-summary.html) or the older cron schedule via [WorkflowOptions](https://javadoc.io/doc/io.temporal/temporal-sdk/latest/io/temporal/client/WorkflowOptions.html)?
2. How do you define "fail"?

- We are scheduling cronjobs in Temporal using the WorkflowOptions.
- With failing i mean that the running cronjob will be terminated after reaching retry limit and does not reschedule the next job
e.g. Job is scheduled for every day at 08:30. 
The job fails due to an issue and reaches is retry limit. Then it has the status "terminated". At the next day at 08:30 no job will be run because of the termination.

There are cases where the system will terminate a workflow, can you provide an example workflow history that reproduces this?

I would also strongly encourage you to use the newer schedules feature, which is more robust and decoupled from the lifetime of a workflow.
i'll try it with the schedules feature. Thank you for reply.

title: Scheduled Temporal Workflow - Does not reschedule after failing
